title: archive/tar: WriterHeader succeeds for bad headers
body:
Using `go1.6`

Some combination of fields tar.Header are simply impossible to encode for *any* format. Some example situations that we currently "succeed" in, but should really error on:
* [Example](https://play.golang.org/p/AhkCnII2Mp): String fields can incorrectly have the NUL character in them. This is not allowed since the tar format uses C-strings.
* [Example](https://play.golang.org/p/tN-ztrm1sN): PAX attribute keys incorrectly allow the '=' character. This is not allowed since PAX uses the 'length keyword=value' format to encode attributes.
* [Example](https://play.golang.org/p/2RxzoLv4pg): Encoding of overflow integers causes the NUL terminator to disappear. In this situation, we should upgrade to using the base256 format, rather overflowing the base8 format.
* [Example](https://play.golang.org/p/VzOpvRu7UP): Encoding of negative integers is incorrectly allowed in octal format. The GNU format seems to handle negative numbers, but only in the base256 format, not base8.
